{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499196,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T19:47:57.444Z","cooked":"

I am setting up the the vision template for advantage kit, and I was wondering how to find the position of the cameras for the Transform3ds in the vision template

We are using our 2024 robot as a test bench, and I have these camera modules I made. I can get the distances, so I am pretty sure I know how to calculate the XY using the CAD

image1234×1217 203 KB

I also put the cameras angled 20 degrees up and 20 degrees out

However, I am unsure where the reference is. I am guessing the origin (XYZ = 0) is on the ground in the center of the robot.

The picture above would imply the camera is (after converting inches to meters) X = 0.297, Y = 0.272, Z = .188 (~ 7.4 inches off the ground)
Does that seem correct?

As for the angles, I am unsure how I calculate those. Can someone help with that?

Which way is X and Y on the robot? I have it in CAD as +Y = forward, +X = right (as if you were sitting in the robot looking forward). Is that correct?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T19:47:57.444Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":108,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":559.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484690,"topic_slug":"advantagekit-vision-template-how-to-find-camera-position","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/advantagekit-vision-template-how-to-find-camera-position/484690/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3500362,"name":"gcschmit","username":"gcschmit","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gcschmit/{size}/5380_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T02:04:35.607Z","cooked":"

From the robot’s perspective, +X is forward and +Y is to the left. Details are here. In terms of the robot-to-camera transform, the origin is the center of the robot on the carpet. (It is helpful to have this as the origin in your CAD.)

The rotation part of the transform would be something like:

new Rotation3d(0, Units.degreesToRadians(-20), Units.degreesToRadians(20)));

The values are the roll, pitch, and yaw. This coordinate system is documented here. However, based on your CAD, the yaw may be negative or another angle like 160°. Think of the rotation portion as how you could rotate your robot to align it to the orientation of the camera.

Oh, and since you are using AdvantageKit, log the robot-to-camera transform and then display it in AdvantageScope as axes. This makes it easy to confirm the angles. If you also have your robot’s CAD in AdvantageScope, it makes it easy to confirm the position as well.
